name: soft solder production, Sn97Cu3 | soft solder, Sn97Cu3 | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3748/documentation

The inventory is meant to be used as a background dataset for technical processes using soft solder. The lead-free product investigated is Sn97Cu3 that is made from tin (97%) and copper (3%). The investigation is based on data provided by a producer and information from literature.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

The activity starts with the raw materials entering the process.

Gate to gate including solder mixing and casting, atomisation and paste mixing, including estimate for emissions and infrastructure.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/202:Manufacture of other chemical products/2029:Manufacture of other chemical products n.e.c.

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time of publications. Most data for 2000.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Producer in Germany and literature data for Europe
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Production of lead-free soft solder from metals tin and copper.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: From one producer to European average. This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography RER. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
